alert.note: Alert for Lauderdale; Tipton (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 26 at 11:34AM CDT until April 07 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Arkansas...Tennessee... Mississippi River at Osceola For the Lower Mississippi River...including Osceola...elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FRIDAY, APRIL 07... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Mississippi River at Osceola. * WHEN...Until Friday, April 07. * IMPACTS...At 29.0 feet, In Arkansas, water is going over the north side of Craighead Point. The pumphouse area for the power plant south of Osceola is flooded. In Tennessee, Lauderdale County Road 924 begins to flood, isolating a house on Island 34. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:00 AM CDT Sunday the stage was 13.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage early Friday morning to a crest of 29.0 feet early Sunday morning. It will then fall below flood stage Monday, April 03. - Action stage is 24.0 feet. - Flood stage is 28.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at weather.gov/memphis. The next statement will be issued as conditions warrant.
